So, what we have are decentralized servers, which store all the data that the client needs to run.

and also the way that the files are replicated together.

But we want to store that data as a backup, and for example, if you want to run the world of how it looked a year before,
if you run a full node, which means that you have all the historical data, all you need to do is enlarge your disk and everything will work okay?
The only thing is that you will need two terabytes of disk.
But if you want to run a light node, then you can enable the garage collection, which is a mechanism that deletes all the files from the entities that were overwritten by new ones, right?

well, pins to IPFS, all the files that are synchronized.
